q: How do you install flood panels on wide garage openings?
a: We divide openings into 4–6 ft modular bays joined by compression posts. Each post transfers hydrostatic pressure to the slab. A 16-ft double-door garage typically uses three panels with two posts rated for 4 psi water load.

q: Can flood panels operate with existing garage doors?
a: Yes. Tracks mount externally without interfering with door operation. Panels deploy only during storm alerts and store in wall-mounted brackets afterward.

q: Do garage installations require structural reinforcement?
a: Only if jambs are non-masonry or wood. We add steel inserts or backer plates to achieve pull-out strength ≥1,200 lb per anchor.

q: How much time is needed to deploy garage flood panels?
a: A trained homeowner can secure a two-car opening in 5–7 minutes. Quick-lock cam clamps eliminate the need for tools.

q: What is the recommended storage method?
a: Store panels vertically on padded brackets, gasket side up. Avoid stacking horizontally to prevent compression damage.

q: Can garages with decorative pavers support flood tracks?
a: Yes, we core through pavers into the structural slab and use flush inserts. After season, covers keep anchors invisible.

q: Where can I see a working demo?
a: Visit our Clearwater garage flood-panel installation site or schedule a virtual demonstration.
